creator: jari.aalto@cante.net
text:
I'm using the CVS ant version and CVs oro. Here is the build result under 
Win32/cygwin bash. JDK 1.4.1

root@W2KPICASSO:/cygdrive/d/java/apache/cvs/jakarta-oro/build$ ./build-oro.bat 
Classpath: .;d:\wbin\server\http\apache\jakarta-tomcat-4.1.7-LE-jdk14
\common\lib\servlet.jar;d:\java\apache\jakarta-ant-
cvsbuild\lib;d:\java\apache\jakarta-ant-cvsbuild\lib\ant.jar;d:\java\sun\jdk-
1.4.1\lib\tools.jar;
JAVA_HOME: d:\java\sun\jdk-1.4.1
Buildfile: build-oro.xml

init:

prepare:
    [mkdir] Created dir: D:\java\apache\cvs\jakarta-oro\classes

BUILD FAILED
file:d:/java/apache/cvs/jakarta-oro/build/build-oro.xml:30: The <chmod> task 
doesn't support the "src" attribute.

Total time: 9 seconds

creator: dfs@apache.org
text:
This is an invalid bug.  There is no build-oro.xml in version 2.0.6 and there
is no chmod directive in the 2.0.6 release or latest build.xml.

Please follow the directions at http://jakarta.apache.org/oro/bugs.html
before reporting a bug through bugzilla. Air potential bugs on oro-dev
first, otherwise you're simply wasting our time.  It is not fair to make
others spend their unpaid volunteer time tracking down imagined problems
when you don't have the decency to take a few minutes to see if maybe you
have made a mistake or at least to discuss the problem on the project
mailing list.
